definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Xian1 qu1 Lun4 tan2 Bao4

sentences.english: The Free Press and The Tribune both won prizes for local reporting.
sentences.chinese: 自由报和论坛报同时获得了本地报道大奖。

sentences.english: I guess I'll order the Herald Tribune instead.
sentences.chinese: 我想我可以改订《先驱论坛报》。

sentences.english: On Tuesday, the Tribune sued to get the rest of the information.
sentences.chinese: 周二，《论坛报》要求获得其余的信息。

sentences.english: We got some early press with the Chicago Tribune, that wrote in a small blog post.
sentences.chinese: 芝加哥论坛报最先报道了我们，是一篇小文章。

sentences.english: The newspaper and the stadium are owned by the Tribune Company.
sentences.chinese: 该报纸和瑞格利球场均属芝加哥论坛报公司所有。

sentences.english: Click here for the Chicago Tribune piece on Posner’s opinion.
sentences.chinese: 点击此处阅读芝加哥论坛报对波斯纳意见的报道。

sentences.english: All the text and photos below from international herald tribute.
sentences.chinese: 以下图文均来自国际前锋论坛报。

sentences.english: I am the foreign correspondent in Washington of La Tribuna newspaper of Honduras .
sentences.chinese: 我是洪都拉斯《论坛报》驻华盛顿的记者。

definition: the name of various newspapers, notably Le Monde (France), El Mundo (Spain) and Die Welt (Germany)
Newsweek magazine/also written 新聞周刊|新闻周刊
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
Sing Tao Daily, Hong Kong newspaper

pinyin: Jian3 shi4 fang2 wu4 zhou1 kan1
